docs.lead_paragraph: The rising toll has cast a harsh light on the loose regulations that legal experts say allowed a company to sell an unsafe drug to pain clinics.

headline.seo: Scant Drug Maker Oversight in Meningitis Outbreak
headline.main: Scant Oversight of Drug Maker in Fatal Meningitis Outbreak
headline.print_headline: Scant Oversight of Drug Maker in Fatal Outbreak

docs.abstract: Rising death toll in the growing national meningitis outbreak has cast harsh light on loose regulations that legal experts say allowed New England Compounding Center, drug company, to sell 17,676 vials of an unsafe drug to pain clinics in 23 states; federal health officials have said that all patients injected with steroid drug made by the company need to be tracked down immediately and informed of the danger.
docs.snippet: The rising toll has cast a harsh light on the loose regulations that legal experts say allowed a company to sell an unsafe drug to pain clinics.

byline.contributor: Jess Bidgood and Sheelagh McNeill contributed reporting.
byline.original: By DENISE GRADY, ANDREW POLLACK and SABRINA TAVERNISE
